goal.tools.errorhandling

Class Warning

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.LogRecord
      • goal.tools.logging.GOALLogRecord
        • goal.tools.errorhandling.Warning
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Warning
extends GOALLogRecord

    Handles warning messages. Also counts the number of times a particular type of message has been printed. For debugging purposes, this class also supports printing stack dumps.

    If requested, the stack trace is printed including all sub-causes. This is essential to recovering what really caused the problem.

    By default, a warning message is printed at most 5 times and the stack trace is not printed. These defaults can be changed via the help > preferences > warnings menu.

    Version:
    2 4mar09: uses preferences for all settings.
    Author:
    W.Pasman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Warning

        public Warning(java.lang.String warning)

        Logs a warning message issued by the GOAL interpreter. A stack trace is generated using a 'fake' DummyException DummyException is removed from the stacktrace later, if the stacktrace is requested at all.

        Use the constructor Warning(warning, Throwable) if you are converting an exception into a warning. Otherwise a debugger cannot be provided with the proper information about what happened.

        Parameters:
        warning - The message to be printed.

      • Warning

        public Warning(Debugger debugger,
       java.lang.String warning)

        Logs a warning message issued by the GOAL interpreter. A stack trace is generated using a 'fake' DummyException DummyException is removed from the stacktrace later, if the stacktrace is requested at all.

        Use the constructor Warning(warning, Throwable) if you are converting an exception into a warning. Otherwise a debugger cannot be provided with the proper information about what happened.

        By providing a SteppingDebugger, the issued warning message will contain a reference to that SteppingDebugger, by prefixing the message with [DEBUGGERNAME].

        Parameters:
        warning - The message to be printed. It will be prefixed with [DEBUGGERNAME]
        debugger - The SteppingDebugger in control of the call.

      • Warning

        public Warning(java.lang.String warning,
       java.lang.Throwable error)
        Logs a warning message if the message has not already been printed more often than suppression threshold. Also supports printing stack trace information of the related cause (only if the user preferences indicate this information should be printed).
        Parameters:
        warning - The message to be printed. If this is null, the message "(no explanation available)" will be used. (Trac 1048)
        error - The exception that was the cause of this warning.

      • Warning

        public Warning(Debugger debugger,
       java.lang.String warning,
       java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Logs a warning message if the message has not already been printed more often than suppression threshold. Also supports printing stack trace information of the related cause (only if the user preferences indicate this information should be printed).
        Parameters:
        debugger - The SteppingDebugger in control of the call.
        warning - The message to be printed. If this is null, the message "(no explanation available)" will be used. (Trac 1048) The message will be prefixed with [DEBUGGERNAME].
        cause - The original stack trace.
        error - The exception that was the cause of this warning.

      • suppress

        public static void suppress()
        Temporarily suppress warnings. To enable printing warnings again, call release.

      • release

        public static void release()
        Stop suppressing warnings. Any suppressed warnings are printed immediately.
